statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 3 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 3 \\ -4 \\ 0 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -3 \\ 4 \\ 0 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 5 \\ -12 \\ -8 \\ 9 \\ 20 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 12 \\ 0 \\ -6 \\ -20 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 3 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 3 \\ -4 \\ 0 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -3 \\ 4 \\ 0 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 5 \\ -12 \\ -8 \\ 9 \\ 20 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 12 \\ 0 \\ -6 \\ -20 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
